definition: row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense

sentences.english: The general tried to justify the slaughter of the entire village.
sentences.chinese: 那名將軍試圖對屠村的暴行做出正當解釋。

sentences.english: I was dismayed by the violence.
sentences.chinese: 我對這些暴行感到失望。

sentences.english: that had led to barbarism of Nazi Germany.
sentences.chinese: 導致了納粹德國的野蠻暴行。

sentences.english: Violence breeds in densely populated areas.
sentences.chinese: 暴行常發生在人煙稠密的地區。

sentences.english: April 20th. The first march organized by the Beijing University Student Union Preparation Committee, protesting the violent acts of the army and police the night before at the gate of Xinhua Men.
sentences.chinese: 組織的第一次遊行，抗議昨夜軍警在新華門的暴行。

sentences.english: The citizens of Umboo province openly rebelled against Koong's outrages.
sentences.chinese: 面對孔的暴行，溫布省人民揭竿而起。

sentences.english: Legitimate grievances against police brutality tipped into excuse-making for criminal behavior.
sentences.chinese: 對警察暴行產生的合理不滿轉化爲犯罪的藉口。

sentences.english: Two witnesses to the brutality are Sophia's stepmother Natalia and her son Peter.
sentences.chinese: 索菲婭的繼母納塔莉亞及其子彼得目睹了這場暴行。

sentences.english: Boundless intemperance in nature is a tyranny.
sentences.chinese: 姿情聲色的確是一種暴行。

sentences.english: Seeing such a terrible sight before his eyes, he was savaged by his enemy's atrocity.
sentences.chinese: 看到眼前這可怖的場景，他被敵方的暴行激怒了。

sentences.english: The Chinese official today made condeminations of the violences.
sentences.chinese: 中國官方今天反覆譴責了這些暴行。

sentences.english: MATSUI admits that he heard that foreign governments were protesting against the commission of these atrocities.
sentences.chinese: 松井供認，他知道本國政府對這些暴行的抗議。

sentences.english: Treatment of Bengalis in the late 60s and 71 war.
sentences.chinese: 上個世紀60年代末和71年戰爭對孟加拉人的暴行。

sentences.english: Never would I subject my children to these cruelties.
sentences.chinese: 我永遠都不會讓我的孩子受到這些暴行。

sentences.english: His written confession discloses the ferocity of the invaders.
sentences.chinese: 這份筆供揭露了侵略者的暴行。

sentences.english: Hundreds of people took to the streets to protest against police brutalities .
sentences.chinese: 數百名羣衆上街抗議警察的暴行。

definition: to be devoid of all humanity/inhuman/bestial
to invade China (referring to 19th century imperialist powers and Japan)
so many that the bamboo slats have been exhausted/innumerable crimes (idiom)/see also 罄筆難書|罄笔难书[qing4 bi3 nan2 shu1]
